title: State, Local Governments Slashed Spending After Covid. Next Year Could Be Worse.
sub_head: After drawing on reserves and federal aid, Kansas City leaders cut staff, turn off the city’s fountains and brace for 2021
body:
In March, as the coronavirus was beginning its march across the country, Kansas City leaders approved a budget flush with new spending.
Five months later they pared it back.
The pandemic-induced economic downturn hit the nation’s state and local governments harder and faster than any other in almost 70 years. In May, public-sector employment...
